Instrument_Host.name: MINERVA-II1 Rover-1b OWL
Instrument_Host.description: MINERVA-II (MIcro Nano Experimental Robot Vehicle for Asteroid the Second Generation) is the successor to MINERVA, deployed on the Hayabusa spacecraft. It consists of two containers: MINERVA-II1, which includes two rovers, Rover-1a (named HIBOU) and Rover-1b (named OWL), as well as onboard equipment. The primary goal of these rovers is to test efficient movement by hopping on the low-gravity surface of asteroid Ryugu, utilizing a motor-driven swing-arm for propulsion. Both rovers are designed to operate autonomously. OWL is equipped with solar cells, communication antennas, a wide-angle camera, stereo cameras, and sensors for temperature, optical data, acceleration, and gyroscopic data. Its surfaces are largely covered by solar cells, making it less sensitive to sunlight than HIBOU.
